Class GamePanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |

                    +--uovision.GamePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.io.Serializable
class GamePanel
extends java.awt.Panel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

This is the panel where the actual game plays in.

It does not much than repainting the image created from ScreenRenderer for each new frame.
Mouse and keyboard capturing should maybe occour hear instead of GameWindow.
Future will show whats more elegent/convinient.

See Also:
